title: [Large-Scale] Scientific Inquiry Courseware Design and Development Capability Enhancement Using Integrated Modeling Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic instructional design principles and experience with digital learning tools, comprehension of the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis formulation–experiment design–data collection/measurement–analysis), and foundational statistical analysis skills
context.additional_context: Mobile-optimized learning environment for current practitioners, applying BYOD policies—includes built-in observation/measurement tools (temperature/pressure/time sensors) for field-oriented scientific problem-solving and supports controlled experiment design for comparative analysis of experimental results.

learning_goals: Apply the four models of Courseware Engineering Methodology (CEM)—instructional, conceptual, interface, and hypermedia—to design science experiment modules and strengthen variable control capabilities—identifying and controlling independent/dependent variables during experimental design.

Acquire practical skills in an integrated modeling approach for developing mobile-friendly microlearning content—systematically integrating the scientific hypothesis verification process (observation→hypothesis→experiment→analysis→conclusion).

Develop interactive courseware through project-based assessment, achieving 80%+ learner engagement—including experimental data analysis and evidence-based conclusion activities (utilizing data visualization and statistical analysis tools).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
